isis.stitle: New Vehicle Loss and Damage Procedures Manual - After-Hours Delivery

svcproc.title: After-Hours Delivery
svcproc.para: Should special arrangements be made for after-hours delivery, the following procedures should be observed:

step1.para: An employee must be on the premises to receive and sign the carrier's receipt for delivery.
This receipt should be signed with time and date specified, along with the notation, " Received Subject to Working Hours Inspection", " STI" for short.
Two copies of the delivery receipt should be held by the receiving location.
A thorough inspection must be made of the vehicle(s) on the first working day following the after-hours delivery.
A copy of the delivery receipt containing all exceptions is to be sent by Certified Mail to the carrier within 48 hours of the after-hours delivery.

Any after-hours deliveries to body companies and fleet locations that are noted as " STI" should be transmitted to the ordering dealer immediately, to allow them time to respond to the carrier within the 48-hour time frame.
Notating a carrier's delivery receipt "STI" DOES NOT INSURE the payment of the claim. The claim may still be denied by the carrier or the International Warranty Center pending further review.
Torque all axle shaft nuts and or u-joints to specification per Preparation and Delivery (P&D) guidelines before moving the vehicle.
If concealed damage is found, follow the instructions below for the proper handling for notification of concealed damage.

para.emph: Vehicles should never be received and noted "STI" during normal receiving hours.
